summary: Valentine-themed interactive website for girlfriend (Yashika) with pink UI, playful Yes/No interaction, multi-step gift reveal with balloons/photo animations, and final valentine message screen.
architectural_notes: Photo assets should be added as static files under frontend/public/assets and referenced via the existing configuration/constants (asset filenames) for Gift 2 (her photos), Gift 3 (couple photos), and the final hero photo.

existing_features.title: Create a single-page Valentine experience with a 3-step flow: (1) Landing question screen, (2) Gifts screen with 3 gift sections, (3) Final celebration screen after completion.

Landing screen UI: use a dark-pink themed background and render two large buttons: a dark-pink “Yes” button and a light-pink “No” button. The question text must be in English and include the name “Yashika” (e.g., “Will you be my Valentine, Yashika?”).
Implement an evasive “No” button interaction: when the user tries to hover/touch/click the “No” button, it shifts to a new position so it cannot be selected.

Gifts screen: after selecting “Yes”, show three distinct gift sections/cards (Gift 1, Gift 2, Gift 3) that can be opened one-by-one in order (Gift 2 locked until Gift 1 opened; Gift 3 locked until Gift 2 opened).
Gift 1 content: display a short love letter/note in English (include the user-provided idea “I give it to you as a letter”) and present it with a simple reveal animation when Gift 1 is opened.
Gift 2 content: show a small gallery of “her photos only”. Implement this using static image assets placed under frontend/public/assets (use provided placeholder images until the user replaces them).

Gift 3 content: show a couple-photos section (“we and my girl” photos). When Gift 3 is opened, first play a multi-balloon rising animation (multiple balloons moving upward), and only after the balloons animation completes, reveal the couple photos.
Completion: after the last gift (Gift 3) is opened and its reveal sequence finishes, show a prominent “Click to Done” button. On click, navigate to the Final celebration screen.
Final celebration screen: display a large couple photo centered, and below it show the English text “I got my valentine” followed by a heart symbol.

Apply one coherent, creative visual theme consistently across all screens using dark pink + light pink as the core palette (avoid blue/purple). Define typography, spacing, card styles, and button styles so the experience feels like a single designed product.

Add a small configuration section (constants) in the frontend code for: girlfriend name (default “Yashika”), note/letter text, and the asset filenames used for Gift 2, Gift 3, and the Final photo, so the content can be updated easily without changing logic.

Add a small, clearly labeled help entry point on the Gifts screen that explains (in English) how to add/replace photos used by Gift 2 (HER_PHOTOS), Gift 3 (COUPLE_PHOTOS), and the Final celebration photo (FINAL_COUPLE_PHOTO).

Add graceful UI handling for missing/broken photo assets in the Gift 2 gallery, Gift 3 gallery, and Final celebration photo so the page does not look broken if a filename is wrong or an image is not uploaded yet.
